lines.text: I get sick of being asked... for good old Indian wisdom. I've got none. So get the hell out of here!
The stories of our ancestors. How they solved problems. Often the problems never change. Nor the people.
Yeah, well it's just too bad those stories don't tell us how to keep our reservations from turning into sewers.
Now you're wasting your time, Sandy. You see, my red, it don't wash off.
Your pony is an old nag.

[sees Philbert's car]
What, are you traveling incognito as a garbage man?
Hey, Fat Philbert... come. Chief Dull Knife once said to my Great Uncle Benny Looks Twice... Keep your pony out of my garden!

[puzzled]
... Keep your pony out of my garden?
This ain't the American Dream here. This is the Third World!
Rabbit? What tribe are me and Jane?
Let's go get a drink Phil.
Well that's the first good idea you've had.
